title: On polynomial automorphisms commuting with a simple derivation
authors: Pierre-Louis Montagard, Iv\'an Pan, Alvaro Rittatore
abstract:
Let $D$ be a simple derivation of the polynomial ring
$\mathbb{k}[x_1,\dots,x_n]$, where $\mathbb{k}$ is an algebraically closed
field of characteristic zero, and denote by
$\operatorname{Aut}(D)\subset\operatorname{Aut}(\mathbb{k}[x_1,\dots,x_n])$ the
subgroup of $\mathbb{k}$-automorphisms commuting with $D$. We show that the
connected component of $\operatorname{Aut}(D)$ passing through the identity is
a unipotent algebraic group of dimension at most $n-2$, this bound being sharp.
Moreover, $\operatorname{Aut}(D)$ is an algebraic group if and only if it is a
connected ind-group. Given a simple derivation $D$, we characterize when
$\operatorname{Aut}(D)$ contains a normal subgroup of translations. As an
application of our techniques we show that if $n=3$, then either
$\operatorname{Aut}(D)$ is a discrete group or it is isomorphic to the additive
group acting by translations, and give some insight on the case $n=4$.
